title: Contributing
Contributing
text: project uses pre-commit hooks. hooks series automated checks run locally. automate mundane tasks running spellchecking, linter, potential issues even push changes!

title: Contributing
text: get started need install pre-commit tool. Additionally, lintr, pkgdown, testthat packages installed either globally within renv (project uses ). install pre-commit, pick method suits best: using pip (package installer Python): pip install pre-commit pip3 install pre-commit using homebrew: brew install pre-commit using precommit package: follow installation section vignette installed pre-commit, run pre-commit install set hooks.

title: Contributing
text: package dependencies changed, list additional_dependencies roxygenize hook updated. list can generated using helper function precommit package: precommit::snippet_generate("additional-deps-roxygenize").

title: Contributing
text: use MacOS installed R via homebrew, chances pre-commit fail setup environment. workaround installing R means, e.g. using rig. lintr might report false positive warnings object_usage_linter. can fixed install package contributions prior running linter.

title: NA
text: Clearly concisely describe ’s pull request. Include screenshots, necessary.

text: read Contributing Guidelines? NEWS.md file updated Development version bumped (x.y.z.90XX) Issue linked PR (via Closing keywords right sidebar Development)

title: Use External Databases with shiny.telemetry
text: data storage backend create necessary tables (“Collection” case MongoDB) respective schema needed. arguments create data storage instance vary, different databases require options. However, data storage object created, read write operations API. find chunks create data storage object supported database. PostgreSQL MariaDB / MySQL MS SQL Server MongoDB SQLite notes: dbname database needs created running application shiny.telemetry; driver allows users use either RPostgreSQL RPostgres R packages; .Renviron file default way R setting environment variables (instead Sys.setenv() shown convenience). run PostgreSQL container locally, can use following Docker compose file: inst/examples/postgresql/docker-compose.yml. notes: dbname database needs created running application shiny.telemetry; .Renviron file default way R setting environment variables (instead Sys.setenv() shown convenience). run MariaDB container locally, can use following Docker compose file: inst/examples/mariadb/docker-compose.yml. notes: dbname database needs created running application shiny.telemetry; .Renviron file default way R setting environment variables (instead Sys.setenv() shown convenience). run Microsoft SQL Server container locally, can use following Docker compose file: inst/examples/mssql/docker-compose.yml. Unlike database backends, SQLite requires path file Shiny application can write .
code: Sys.setenv("POSTGRES_USER" = "postgres", "POSTGRES_PASS" = "mysecretpassword") data_storage <- DataStoragePostgreSQL$new(   user = Sys.getenv("POSTGRES_USER"),   password = Sys.getenv("POSTGRES_PASS"),   hostname = "127.0.0.1",   port = 5432,   dbname = "shiny_telemetry",   driver = "RPostgreSQL" ) Sys.setenv("MARIADB_USER" = "mariadb", "MARIADB_PASS" = "mysecretpassword") data_storage <- DataStorageMariaDB$new(   user = Sys.getenv("MARIADB_USER"),    password = Sys.getenv("MARIADB_PASS"),   hostname = "127.0.0.1",   port = 3306,   dbname = "shiny_telemetry" ) Sys.setenv(MSSQL_USER = "sa", MSSQL_PASS = "my-Secr3t_Password") data_storage <- DataStorageMSSQLServer$new(   user = Sys.getenv("MSSQL_USER"),   password = Sys.getenv("MSSQL_PASS"),   hostname = "127.0.0.1",    port = 1433,   dbname = "my_db",    driver = "ODBC Driver 18 for SQL Server",    trust_server_certificate = "YES" ) data_storage <- DataStorageMongoDB$new(   host = "localhost",   dbname = "test",   authdb = NULL,   options = NULL,   ssl_options = mongolite::ssl_options() )  To run MongoDB in a container locally, you can use the following Docker compose file: [`inst/examples/mssql/docker-compose.yml`](https://github.com/Appsilon/shiny.telemetry/blob/main/inst/examples/mongodb/docker-compose.yml). data_storage <- DataStorageSQLite$new(   db_path = "telemetry.sqlite" )

title: Use External Databases with shiny.telemetry
text: data storage API read write events shiny.telemetry consistent across backends, allows developer implement test package convenient backend easily migrate external database. Therefore, initialized can used create Telemetry object start session.
code: # data_storage variable is initialized with one of the previous code chunks. telemetry <- Telemetry$new(data_storage = data_storage) # 1. Initialize telemetry with object created above  shinyApp(   ui = fluidPage(     use_telemetry(), # 2. Add necessary javascript to Shiny     numericInput("n", "n", 1),     plotOutput('plot')   ),   server = function(input, output) {     telemetry$start_session() # 3. Minimal setup to track events     output$plot <- renderPlot({ hist(runif(input$n)) })   } )

title: Setup shiny.telemetry in a Rhino application
text: Starting new rhino application simple running rhino::init() command. Learn “Creating first Rhino app” guide. command creates boilerplate folder structure rhino application, app/main.R contains UI server logic. application structure best explained “App structure” documentation. setting shiny.telemetry application, let’s add simple input element boilerplate code. Otherwise, events tracked login, logout user’s browser version. add text input application sections observe tracked {shiny.telemtry}. Adding code app/main.R file add text input “Hello world” message contents input.
code: # app/main.R (replace with the following code) box::use(   shiny[     bootstrapPage, div, moduleServer, NS, renderUI, tags, textInput, uiOutput,      verbatimTextOutput,   ], )  #' @export ui <- function(id) {   ns <- NS(id)   bootstrapPage(     textInput(ns("name"), "My name", "world"),     verbatimTextOutput(ns("text")),     uiOutput(ns("message"))   ) }  #' @export server <- function(id) {   moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {     output$message <- renderUI({       div(         style = "display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; height: 50vh;",         tags$h1(           tags$span(sprintf("Hello %s! ", input$name)),           tags$a("Check out Rhino docs!", href = "https://appsilon.github.io/rhino/")         )       )     })   }) }

title: Setup shiny.telemetry in a Rhino application
text: Alternatively, can add shiny.telemetry existing rhino application following steps next sections. Please note, input elements application, events tracked login, logout user’s browser version.

title: Setup shiny.telemetry in a Rhino application
text: following 4 steps needed start using shiny.telemetry tracking inputs application: Import functions shiny.telemetry using box; Add Javascript code UI definition; Create Telemetry object; Start telemetry session attached Shiny session. first step install shiny.telemetry :
code: rhino::pkg_install("shiny.telemetry")

title: Setup shiny.telemetry in a Rhino application
text: rhino frameworks promotes use box import functions packages internal modules. See rhino documentation write R code details. minimal setup shiny.telemetry needs import: Class chosen DataStorage backend (e.g. DataStorageLogFile text-based storage, DataStorageMariaDB MariaDB database, among others); Class Telemetry function track events; Function load necessary Javascript code UI definition. additional function used, needs imported well. can done adding following code top app/main.R file package imports:
code: # app/main.R (top of file) box::use(   shiny[     bootstrapPage, div, moduleServer, NS, renderUI, tags, textInput, uiOutput,     verbatimTextOutput,   ],   # other packaage imports ...   shiny.telemetry[DataStorageLogFile, Telemetry, use_telemetry], )

what: Add Javascript code to UI definition
title: Setup shiny.telemetry in a Rhino application
text: next step call use_telemetry() function root UI definition app/main.R file load necessary Javascript code. Note id parameter needs passed use_telemetry() function ensure browser version tracked correctly, well mechanism track anonymous user via client side cookies.
code: # app/main.R (change n `ui` function) #' @export ui <- function(id) {   ns <- NS(id)   bootstrapPage(     use_telemetry(id),     tags$div(       style = "display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; margin-top: 2em;",       textInput(ns("name"), "My name", "world")     ),     verbatimTextOutput(ns("text")),     uiOutput(ns("message"))   ) }

title: Setup shiny.telemetry in a Rhino application
text: next step create Telemetry object used track events app. recommend creating instance Telemetry app/main.R start telemetry session root server function definition, just shown code . create text file events tracked shiny.telemetry. simplest storage backend available file contains JSON data can easily read processed. learn backends see “Use External Databases shiny.telemetry” guide. Please note, values tracked default need enabled setting track_values parameter TRUE start_session() method. example enabling help demonstrate capabilities shiny.telemetry. telemetry$start_session() call can customized enable/disable different types events can extended include/exclude input ids. See Guide tracking specific inputs details. application now ready track input changes, login, logout browser version. Start application test .
code: # app/main.R (create telemetry object and initialize in a session) telemetry <- Telemetry$new(   app_name = "rhino_app",   data_storage = DataStorageLogFile$new("local_file.txt") )  #' @export server <- function(id) {   moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {     telemetry$start_session(track_values = TRUE)     # Server logic ...   }) } shiny::runApp() # Start the application and change inputs

title: Setup shiny.telemetry in a Rhino application
text: shiny.telemetry package provides default dashboard visualize events tracked application. example use local_file.txt configured application. start dashboard run code installing suggested packages (renv::install("semantic.dashboard", "shinyjs", "plotly", "timevis", "DT")) start dashboard show events tracked application. shows: General stats number events, unique users average session; Activity stats event data input id; Returning anonymous users tracked client side cookies; Session stats duration activity per user session. examples different backends can found inst/examples folder package.
code: # Required suggested packages: #  renv::install("semantic.dashboard", "shinyjs", "plotly", "timevis", "DT") library(shiny.telemetry)  data_storage <- DataStorageLogFile$new("local_file.txt") analytics_app(data_storage = data_storage)

what: Alternative methods to access event data
title: Setup shiny.telemetry in a Rhino application
text: event data can accessed directly, either via DataStorage API shiny.telemetry accessing data directly backend. DataStorage API 2 main functions read write data respective backend. Optionally parameters can used limit results data range application name; insert used write new events backend. read data tracked example can run following code:
code: library(shiny.telemetry) data_storage <- DataStorageLogFile$new("local_file.txt") data_storage$read_event_data()

title: Setup shiny.telemetry in a Rhino application
text: use shiny.telemetry rhino, need make 4 minor adjustments adds six lines code (default options). easy Shiny application. setup allows access shiny.telemetry functionality write events data storage backed write 4 types events: Login timestamp username (available); Browser user agent; Logout timestamp session ends; input changes. learn use Database backends can refer “Use External Databases shiny.telemetry” guide.

title: Setup shiny.telemetry in a Rhino application
text: storage backend can swapped JSON log file used external database just changing data_storage parameter initializing {shiny.telemetr}. learn use different available Database backends can refer “Use External Databases shiny.telemetry” guide. section show use PostgreSQL, one supported databases Rhino application. Using others similar. necessary modification code replace DataStorageLogFile DataStoragePostgreSQL provide necessary connection information. However, recommend using environment variables store sensitive information, passwords, avoid storing directly code. , use config.yml .Renviron files keep information safe. first step changing data storage backend app/main.R file. Notice using config package read secrets config.yml file. Therefore next step import config package box app/main.R file. config.yml can configured read secrets environment, well allowing different configurations different environments. safe commit file repository contain sensitive information . last change .Renviron file keep secrets safe avoid storing directly code. long file committed repository, secrets safe. deploying application POSIT Connect ShinyProxy, secrets can set environment variables deployment configuration. See Rhino guide “Manage secrets environments” details best practices manage secrets environments.
code: # app/main.R (change the data storage backend) telemetry <- Telemetry$new(   app_name = "rhino_app",   data_storage = DataStoragePostgreSQL$new(     user = config$get("postgres_user"),     password = config$get("postgres_pass"),     hostname = config$get("postgres_host"),     port = config$get("postgres_port"),     dbname = config$get("postgres_dbname"),     driver = "RPostgreSQL"   ) ) # app/main.R (top of the file) box::use(   config, # Adds config package that reads config.yml file at the root of the project   shiny[     bootstrapPage, div, moduleServer, NS, renderUI, tags, textInput, uiOutput,     verbatimTextOutput,   ],   # other packaage imports ...   shiny.telemetry[DataStorageLogFile, Telemetry, use_telemetry], ) # config.yml default:   rhino_log_level: !expr Sys.getenv("RHINO_LOG_LEVEL", "INFO")   rhino_log_file: !expr Sys.getenv("RHINO_LOG_FILE", NA)   postgres_user: !expr Sys.getenv("POSTGRES_USER", NA)   postgres_pass: !expr Sys.getenv("POSTGRES_PASS", NA)   postgres_host: !expr Sys.getenv("POSTGRES_HOST", NA)   postgres_port: !expr Sys.getenv("POSTGRES_PORT", 5432)   postgres_dbname: "shiny_telemetry"    staging:   postgres_dbname: "shiny_telemetry_stg"  production:   postgres_dbname: "shiny_telemetry_prd" # .Renviron POSTGRES_USER=postgres POSTGRES_PASS=mysecretpassword POSTGRES_HOST=127.0.0.1

what: Exclude inputs via a regular expression
title: Track a Subset of Inputs to Improve Performance
text: applications shiny.telemetry used, developers want track input changes excluding specific subset input ids patterns. achieve , user can call telemetry$log_all_inputs() excluded_inputs_regex argument. Let’s say want exclude input ids triggered DT package, can use pattern start dt_ contain alpha numeric characters underscore. chunk shows achieve : event specific input id included, regardless excluded regular expression, user can call telemetry$log_all_inputs() include_input_ids argument higher priority included tracking.
code: server <- function(id) {   moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {     telemetry$start_session(track_inputs = FALSE)     telemetry$log_all_inputs(excluded_inputs_regex = "dt_[a-zA-Z0-9_]*$"])      # Server logic ...   }) }

previous_headings: Exclude inputs via a regular expression
what: Exclude inputs by full input id
title: Track a Subset of Inputs to Improve Performance
text: Additionally, user can exclude inputs full input id passing vector input ids excluded_inputs argument.
code: server <- function(id) {   moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {     telemetry$start_session(track_inputs = FALSE)     telemetry$log_all_inputs(excluded_inputs = c("input_1", "ns2-input_1", "input_2"])      # Server logic ...   }) }

what: Track a small subset of input ids
title: Track a Subset of Inputs to Improve Performance
text: small subset inputs tracked ignoring others, user can call telemetry$log_input() one input ids. function called, create observe event input ids tracked.
code: server <- function(id) {   moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {     telemetry$start_session(track_inputs = FALSE)     telemetry$log_input(c("app-input_id_1", "app-input_id_2", "app-ns2-input_id_4")) # 1.     # Server logic ...   }) }

title: Shiny App Usage Telemetry
text: Easy logging users activity session events Shiny App  shiny.telemetry R package tracks events occurring user session, input changes session duration, stores local remote database. provides developers tools help understand users interact Shiny dashboards answer questions : tabs/pages often visited, inputs users changing, average length session, etc.

title: Shiny App Usage Telemetry
text: shiny.telemetry package can installed GitHub using remotes package: dependencies = TRUE suggested packages (required run examples) installed addition mandatory dependencies.
code: remotes::install_github("Appsilon/shiny.telemetry", dependencies = TRUE)

what: How to use in a Shiny Dashboard?
title: Shiny App Usage Telemetry
text: shiny.telemetry allows minimal setup 3 commands can track information session: session starts ends browser version used client Changes inputs (doesn’t track values default) code runs minimal example Shiny application uses shiny.telemetry. package keep track session information changes numericInput. Note: using dashboard nothing happening user’s perspective operation run background (either server Javascript). inspecting code , can breakdown 3 lines code : Global Telemetry object used across different sessions Add necessary Javascript UI calling use_telemetry(). used track browser version. Initialize session-specific tracking calling method start_session() Telemetry object.
code: library(shiny) library(shiny.telemetry)  telemetry <- Telemetry$new() # 1. Initialize telemetry with default options  shinyApp(   ui = fluidPage(     use_telemetry(), # 2. Add necessary javascript to Shiny     numericInput("n", "n", 1),     plotOutput('plot')   ),   server = function(input, output) {     telemetry$start_session() # 3. Minimal setup to track events     output$plot <- renderPlot({ hist(runif(input$n)) })   } )

title: Shiny App Usage Telemetry
text: developers administrators dashboard can access data gathered shiny.telemetry via Telemetry object directly DataStorage via appropriate provider. package includes analytics dashboard view data. located inst/examples/app/analytics modified references correct DataStorage provider configuration.
code: # After running the instrumented app shiny.telemetry::Telemetry$new()$data_storage$read_event_data("2020-01-01", "2050-01-01")  # Default provider and path for Telemetry$new() shiny.telemetry::DataStorageSQLite$new(db_path = "telemetry.sqlite")$read_event_data("2020-01-01", "2050-01-01")

title: Shiny App Usage Telemetry
text: 3 different types data providers can range local filesystem storage remote Plumber REST API instance. SQLite using DataStorageSQLite class Plain text file using DataStorageLogFile class MariaDB using DataStorageMariaDB class PostgreSQL using DataStoragePostgreSQL class MS SQL Server using DataStorageMSSQLServer class turn, Plumber data provider use one classes method data storage. setup plumber requires valid Plumber instance running network communication can protected. See Plumber deployment documentation information.

title: Shiny App Usage Telemetry
text: package uses logger package internally shiny.telemetry namespace. debug shiny.telemetry calls dashboard, change threshold namespace DEBUG: note: command can run Shiny call adding .Rprofile.
code: logger::log_threshold("DEBUG", namespace = "shiny.telemetry")

code: log_file_path <- tempfile(fileext = ".txt") data_storage <- DataStorageLogFile$new(log_file_path = log_file_path)  data_storage$insert("example", "test_event", "session1") data_storage$insert("example", "input", "s1", list(id = "id")) data_storage$insert("example", "input", "s1", list(id = "id2", value = 32))  data_storage$insert(   "example", "test_event_3_days_ago", "session1",   time = lubridate::as_datetime(lubridate::today() - 3) )  data_storage$read_event_data() #> # A tibble: 4 × 8 #>   app_name type      session time                id    value date       username #>   <chr>    <chr>     <chr>   <dttm>              <chr> <chr> <date>     <chr>    #> 1 example  test_eve… sessio… 2025-04-09 09:15:16 NA    NA    2025-04-09 NA       #> 2 example  input     s1      2025-04-09 09:15:16 id    NA    2025-04-09 NA       #> 3 example  input     s1      2025-04-09 09:15:16 id2   32    2025-04-09 NA       #> 4 example  test_eve… sessio… 2025-04-06 00:00:00 NA    NA    2025-04-06 NA       data_storage$read_event_data(Sys.Date() - 1, Sys.Date() + 1) #> # A tibble: 3 × 8 #>   app_name type      session time                id    value date       username #>   <chr>    <chr>     <chr>   <dttm>              <chr> <chr> <date>     <chr>    #> 1 example  test_eve… sessio… 2025-04-09 09:15:16 NA    NA    2025-04-09 NA       #> 2 example  input     s1      2025-04-09 09:15:16 id    NA    2025-04-09 NA       #> 3 example  input     s1      2025-04-09 09:15:16 id2   32    2025-04-09 NA        file.remove(log_file_path) #> [1] TRUE

what: Data storage class with MS SQL Server provider — DataStorageMSSQLServer
title: Data storage class with MS SQL Server provider — DataStorageMSSQLServer
text: Implementation DataStorage R6 class MS SQL Server backend using unified API read/write operations. provider requires configured named ODBC driver set system, example, "ODBC Driver 17 SQL Server" "ODBC Driver 18 SQL Server". Note MS SQL Server support requires subtly different database schema: time field stored DATETIME rather TIMESTAMP.

title: Data storage class with MS SQL Server provider — DataStorageMSSQLServer

title: Data storage class with MS SQL Server provider — DataStorageMSSQLServer
text: username string MS SQL Server username. password string password username. hostname string hostname MS SQL Server instance. port numeric value port number MS SQL Server instance. dbname string name database MS SQL Server instance. driver string name ODBC driver class MS SQL, example "ODBC Driver 17 SQL Server". trust_server_certificate string "" "YES", setting whether trust server's certificate implicitly.

title: Data storage class with MongoDB provider — DataStorageMongoDB
text: hostname hostname IP address MongoDB server. port port number MongoDB server (default 27017). username username authentication (optional). password password authentication (optional). authdb default authentication database (optional). dbname name database (default "shiny_telemetry"). options Additional connection options named list format (e.g., list(ssl = "true", replicaSet = "myreplicaset")) (optional). ssl_options additional connection options SSL keys/certs (default mongolite::ssl_options()).

code: Telemetry$start_session(   track_inputs = TRUE,   track_values = FALSE,   login = TRUE,   logout = TRUE,   browser_version = TRUE,   navigation_input_id = NULL,   session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain(),   username = NULL,   track_anonymous_user = TRUE,   track_errors = TRUE )

title: Telemetry class to manage analytics gathering at a global level — Telemetry
text: track_inputs flag indicates basic telemetry track inputs change value. TRUE default track_values flag indicates basic telemetry track values inputs changing. FALSE default. parameter ignored track_inputs FALSE login flag indicates basic telemetry track session starts. TRUE default. logout flag indicates basic telemetry track session ends. TRUE default. browser_version flag indicates browser version tracked.TRUE default. navigation_input_id string vector strings represent input ids value tracked navigation events. .e. change value represent navigation page tab. default, navigation tracked. session ShinySession object NULL identify current Shiny session. username Character username. set, overwrite username session object. track_anonymous_user flag indicates track anonymous user. cookie used track user without login multiple sessions, activated none automatic methods produce username username explicitly defined.TRUE default. track_errors flag indicates basic telemetry track errors. TRUE default. using shiny version < 1.8.1, can auto log errors UI output functions. using latest versions shiny, can auto log types errors.

title: Telemetry class to manage analytics gathering at a global level — Telemetry
Telemetry class to manage analytics gathering at a global level — Telemetry
code: log_file_path <- tempfile(fileext = ".txt") telemetry <- Telemetry$new(   data_storage = DataStorageLogFile$new(log_file_path = log_file_path) ) # 1. Initialize telemetry with default options  # # Use in a shiny application  if (interactive()) {   library(shiny)    shinyApp(     ui = fluidPage(       use_telemetry(), # 2. Add necessary javascript to Shiny       numericInput("n", "n", 1),       plotOutput('plot')     ),     server = function(input, output) {       telemetry$start_session() # 3. Minimal setup to track events       output$plot <- renderPlot({ hist(runif(input$n)) })     }   ) }  # # Manual logging of Telemetry that can be used inside Shiny Application # to further customize the events to be tracked.  session <- shiny::MockShinySession$new() # Create dummy session (only for example purposes) class(session) <- c(class(session), "ShinySession")  telemetry$log_click("a_button", session = session)  telemetry$log_error("global", message = "An error has occured")  telemetry$log_custom_event("a_button", list(value = 2023), session = session) telemetry$log_custom_event("a_button", list(custom_field = 23), session = session)  # Manual call login with custom username telemetry$log_login("ben", session = session)  # Read all data telemetry$data_storage$read_event_data() #> # A tibble: 5 × 11 #>   app_name    type   session id    output_id message value custom_field username #>   <chr>       <chr>  <chr>   <chr> <chr>     <chr>   <chr> <chr>        <chr>    #> 1 (dashboard) click  a7eeaa… a_bu… NA        NA      NA    NA           NA       #> 2 (dashboard) error  NA      NA    global    An err… NA    NA           NA       #> 3 (dashboard) a_but… a7eeaa… NA    NA        NA      2023  NA           NA       #> 4 (dashboard) a_but… a7eeaa… NA    NA        NA      NA    23           NA       #> 5 (dashboard) login  a7eeaa… NA    NA        NA      NA    NA           ben      #> # ℹ 2 more variables: time <dttm>, date <date>  file.remove(log_file_path) #> [1] TRUE  # # Using SQLite  db_path <- tempfile(fileext = ".sqlite") telemetry_sqlite <- Telemetry$new(   data_storage = DataStorageSQLite$new(db_path = db_path) )  telemetry_sqlite$log_custom_event("a_button", list(value = 2023), session = session) telemetry_sqlite$log_custom_event("a_button", list(custom_field = 23), session = session)  # Read all data from time range telemetry_sqlite$data_storage$read_event_data("2020-01-01", "2055-01-01") #> # A tibble: 2 × 9 #>   time                app_name session type  value custom_field date       id    #>   <dttm>              <chr>    <chr>   <chr> <chr> <chr>        <date>     <chr> #> 1 2025-04-09 09:15:19 (dashbo… a7eeaa… a_bu… 2023  NA           2025-04-09 NA    #> 2 2025-04-09 09:15:19 (dashbo… a7eeaa… a_bu… NA    23           2025-04-09 NA    #> # ℹ 1 more variable: username <chr>  file.remove(db_path) #> [1] TRUE

title: shiny.telemetry 0.3.1.9001
shiny.telemetry 0.3.1.9001
text: Fixed problem concurrent writes log file backend.

title: shiny.telemetry 0.3.1
shiny.telemetry 0.3.1
text: Added log_errors method allows users track errors Shiny apps outside start_session (#189).

title: shiny.telemetry 0.3.1
text: Fixed problem log_all_inputs call crashed telemetry (#187). Fixed error appearing analytics app (#188).

title: shiny.telemetry 0.3.0
shiny.telemetry 0.3.0
text: Added shiny error tracking (activated default start_session) (#116). Updated get_user method retrieve user shinyproxy environment (#124). Added flexibility select [RPostgreSQL, RPostgres] drivers (#147). Improved input tracking implementing inclusion exclusion logic (#30). Added tracking returning anonymous users (#142). Added support MongoDB (see DataStorageMongoDB class) (#174).

title: shiny.telemetry 0.3.0
text: Updates documentation use markdown format (#153). Improves SQL injection safeguards via glue::glue_sql generated SQL queries (#34). Show proper error message telemetry data available (#177). Adds -guides site (#179 #180)

title: shiny.telemetry 0.3.0
text: Fixed Analytics app able access data Instrumentation app (#164). Fixed SQLite data storage backend reading date column (#182).

title: shiny.telemetry 0.2.0
shiny.telemetry 0.2.0
text: Allowed optional username overwrite (#123). Added MS SQL Server support (see DataStorageMSSQLServer class) (#128). Added CI tests DBI-based DataStorage providers (#129). Added optional parameter read_event_data filters app_name (#129).

title: shiny.telemetry 0.2.0
text: Fixed way getting session token (#120). Fixed loading complex nested payloads (#133).
